009
010package imagingbook.common.sift;
011
012import java.awt.Shape;
013import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
014import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class defines a SIFT descriptor. See Sec. 25.3 of [1] for more details.
023 * Instances are immutable.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
027 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2020/10/04 added scale level for display reasons
032 * @version 2022/11/20
033 */
034public class SiftDescriptor implements Pnt2d, Comparable<SiftDescriptor> {
035        
036        private final double x; // image position
037        private final double y;
038        private final int scaleLevel;
039        private final double scale;
040        private final double magnitude;
041        private final double orientation;
042        private final int[] features;
043        
044        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
045        
046        // Constructor (non-public)
047        SiftDescriptor(double x, double y, double scale, int scaleLevel, double magnitude, double orientation, int[] features) {
048                this.x = x;
049                this.y = y;
050                this.scale = scale;
051                this.scaleLevel = scaleLevel;
052                this.magnitude = magnitude;
053                this.orientation = orientation;
054                this.features = features;
055        }
056        
057        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
058        
059        @Override
060        public double getX() {
061                return x;
062        }
063
064        @Override
065        public double getY() {
066                return y;
067        }
068
069        /**
070         * Returns this descriptor's absolute scale (&sigma;).
071         * 
072         * @return the absolute scale
073         */
074        public double getScale() {
075                return scale;
076        }
077        
078        /**
079         * Returns this descriptor's scale level (scale space octave index p).
080         * 
081         * @return the scale level
082         */
083        public int getScaleLevel() {
084                return scaleLevel;
085        }
086        
087        /**
088         * Returns this descriptor's gradient response magnitude (score).
089         * 
090         * @return the gradient response magnitude
091         */
092        public double getMagnitude() {
093                return magnitude;
094        }
095
096        /**
097         * Returns this descriptor's orientation angle (in radians).
098         * 
099         * @return the orientation angle
100         */
101        public double getOrientation() {
102                return orientation;
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Returns this descriptor's feature vector (array of integers).
107         * 
108         * @return the feature vector
109         */
110        public int[] getFeatures() {
111                return features;
112        }
113        
114        // -----------------------------
115        
116        private static final VectorNorm DefaultNorm = VectorNorm.L2.getInstance();
117        
118        /**
119         * Calculates and returns the distance between this descriptor's feature vector
120         * and another descriptor's feature vector using the Euclidean distance
121         * ({@link VectorNorm.L2}).
122         * 
123         * @param other another {@link SiftDescriptor}
124         * @return the distance
125         */
126        public double getDistance(SiftDescriptor other) {
127                return DefaultNorm.distance(this.features, other.features);
128        }
129        
130        /**
131         * Calculates and returns the distance between this descriptor's feature vector
132         * and another descriptor's feature vector using the specified {@link VectorNorm}.
133         * 
134         * @param other another {@link SiftDescriptor}
135         * @param norm a {@link VectorNorm} instance
136         * @return the distance
137         */
138        public double getDistance(SiftDescriptor other, VectorNorm norm) {
139                return norm.distance(this.features, other.features);
140        }
141        
142        // -----------------------------
143
144        @Override       // returns an oriented M-shaped polygon centered at (x,y)
145        public Shape getShape(double featureScale) {
146                double d = featureScale * this.getScale();
147                // create M-shaped path around origin oriented along x-axis:
148                Path2D poly = new Path2D.Double();
149                poly.moveTo(0, 0);
150                poly.lineTo(d, d);
151                poly.lineTo(-d, d);
152                poly.lineTo(-d, -d);
153                poly.lineTo(d, -d);
154                poly.closePath();
155                // translate and rotate shape:
156                AffineTransform atf = new AffineTransform();
157                atf.translate(this.getX(), this.getY());
158                atf.rotate(this.getOrientation());
159                return atf.createTransformedShape(poly);
160        }
161        
162        // -----------------------------
163        
164        @Override
165        public String toString() {
166                return String.format(Locale.US, 
167                                "%s[x=%.1f y=%.1f scale=%.2f mag=%.4f angle=%.2f]", 
168                                getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y, scale, magnitude, orientation);
169        }
170
171        
172        @Override // for sorting SIFT descriptors by descreasing magnitude
173        public int compareTo(SiftDescriptor other) {
174                return Double.compare(other.magnitude, this.magnitude);
175        }
176
177}
